medical_history.chief_complaint: Blurring of vision affecting both eyes, which was gradual, progressive, and painless.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The vision blurring started 4 months prior to presentation and was not associated with redness, discharge, or abnormal sensation in the eyes. There was a history of similar visual disturbances intermittently over the last 3 years, previously limited to the right eye. The patient also experienced weakness in the right leg causing difficulty in walking and had an episode of inability to move both legs and slurred speech approximately 12 years ago, which improved without intervention but recurred periodically.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had withdrawn from other family members and displayed signs of anxiety, along with mood fluctuations. She exhibited forgetfulness and struggled with maintaining focus, leading to the discontinuation of her studies.
